title: >>> REDDI to WIP
body_text:
What a blockbuster!
... Legend Justin Pierce, in his very first season finale captains appearance, did what no man had been able to accomplish - take down the megastar Tom Adams in singles competition. Off the heels of arguably the most exciting, action-packed night in the history of this great sport comes the aftermath by way of a special, and comedic, team attraction.
DODGEBALL 90 has come and gone ... how would you rank it?
10 ... One of the all-time greats.
9 ... Unforgettable.
8 ... Thoroughly enjoyable.
7 ... I'm happy.
6 ... Not too shabby.
5 ... Standard.
4 ... Less than par.
3 ... I expected more.
2 ... A waste.
1 ... Is suicide an option?
(londono &)
PIERCE v. DIBUCCIO
(& adams)
Perhaps no other competitors have created as much havoc and caused as much chaos as these two. This story of big mouths and trash-talking that began way back when at DODGEBALL DAY 2 comes full circle when nearly two years later, each will get the opportunity to deliver the sweet taste of pie.
For "The Piercer", DODGEBALL 90 was undeniably the supreme event as he not only walked away the victor, but was announced as the first captain for the summer spectacular, DODGEBALL 100. There is no question he looks to cap his week in dodgeball heaven. But "blind as a bat" referee Diana DiBuccio is as confident as ever, and will do whatever it takes to turn the so-called dream week into an unforgiving nightmare. The arch rivals may finally put an end to this "battle of the mouths" once and for all. "Best Rivalry" award-winners come in clean, one leaves "creamed".
(pierce &)
LONDONO v. ADAMS
(& dibuccio)
The comedy of this super-sized engagement will forever go down in history as one of the most memorable confrontations. Five months of humiliation and embarrassment have come to this.
A crushing loss to the icon Pierce could only motivate the ultra-athletic Tom Adams even more. The self-proclaimed "Greek god" seeks vengeance on not only his DODGEBALL 90 opponent, but arguably his most irritating enemy. The charismatic, tough as nails Juan Londono's debut at DODGEBALL 73 set the stage for the five month-long war of attrition, as the secret bulletball shots during and even in between games have only escalated this match made in hell. But it won't be a secret or a surprise when one comes face to face with a whipped cream filled pie.
Of the four participants competing in DODGEBALL 91's "CREAMation 2", who would you like to see get "CREAMed" the most?
Juan Londono
Justin Pierce
Diana DiBuccio
Tom Adams
Will "The Piercer" remain at the top of the mountain?
Can Tom pick up the pieces of his first loss?
Will Juan utterly humiliate his biggest, most annoying rival?
And will Diana finally put an end to the war of words?
CREAMation 2
If the first
CREAMation Rules
match is any indication, expect the unexpected at this soon-to-be classic. The losing team captains will indeed suffer the ultimate humiliation. See which dream team gets "creamed" on
June 9
.
body_html:
What a blockbuster! ... Legend Justin Pierce, in his very first season finale captains appearance, did what no man had been able to accomplish - take down the megastar Tom Adams in singles competition. Off the heels of arguably the most exciting, action-packed night in the history of this great sport comes the aftermath by way of a special, and comedic, team attraction.

DODGEBALL 90 has come and gone ... how would you rank it?
  


(londono &) PIERCE v. DIBUCCIO (& adams)
Perhaps no other competitors have created as much havoc and caused as much chaos as these two. This story of big mouths and trash-talking that began way back when at DODGEBALL DAY 2 comes full circle when nearly two years later, each will get the opportunity to deliver the sweet taste of pie.

For "The Piercer", DODGEBALL 90 was undeniably the supreme event as he not only walked away the victor, but was announced as the first captain for the summer spectacular, DODGEBALL 100. There is no question he looks to cap his week in dodgeball heaven. But "blind as a bat" referee Diana DiBuccio is as confident as ever, and will do whatever it takes to turn the so-called dream week into an unforgiving nightmare. The arch rivals may finally put an end to this "battle of the mouths" once and for all. "Best Rivalry" award-winners come in clean, one leaves "creamed".

(pierce &) LONDONO v. ADAMS (& dibuccio)
The comedy of this super-sized engagement will forever go down in history as one of the most memorable confrontations. Five months of humiliation and embarrassment have come to this.

A crushing loss to the icon Pierce could only motivate the ultra-athletic Tom Adams even more. The self-proclaimed "Greek god" seeks vengeance on not only his DODGEBALL 90 opponent, but arguably his most irritating enemy. The charismatic, tough as nails Juan Londono's debut at DODGEBALL 73 set the stage for the five month-long war of attrition, as the secret bulletball shots during and even in between games have only escalated this match made in hell. But it won't be a secret or a surprise when one comes face to face with a whipped cream filled pie.

Of the four participants competing in DODGEBALL 91's "CREAMation 2", who would you like to see get "CREAMed" the most?
Juan Londono
Justin Pierce
Diana DiBuccio
Tom Adams
  

Will "The Piercer" remain at the top of the mountain?
Can Tom pick up the pieces of his first loss?
Will Juan utterly humiliate his biggest, most annoying rival?
And will Diana finally put an end to the war of words?

CREAMation 2
If the first CREAMation Rules match is any indication, expect the unexpected at this soon-to-be classic. The losing team captains will indeed suffer the ultimate humiliation. See which dream team gets "creamed" on June 9.
